docs.text:
Welcome to Java


Here you will learn the basics of Java.


FAQs




Where do I run the code?


You can either 
install BluJ
 (Windows, Mac, and Linux), or you can 
run online






What if I need help?


We're only an 
email away






What if I'm not a part of SD Code?


Don't worry about it! This resource is free to use by anyone!






Can I host this on my website?


Sure, as long as you give credit and link it to our website






How can I contribute?


Submit a pull request to the repository on 
Github








Creators




Nir Levin


Ronak Shah

docs.title: FAQs

docs.text:
Getting Started with Java and Eclipse


For Mac Users


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fAE-dnVUTs0




Download the JDK at http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk10-downloads-4416644.html


Click on the downloaded file and follow the installation prompts


Download Eclipse 64 bit at https://www.eclipse.org/downloads/


Double click on the download file, and move the new eclipse file into your applications folder


To run Eclipse, double click on the "Eclipse" folder, and then double click on the Eclipse icon




For Windows Users


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fAj9qYFKONc




Download the JDK at http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk10-downloads-4416644.html


Click on the downloaded file and follow the installation prompts


Download Eclipse 64 bit at https://www.eclipse.org/downloads/


Right click on the downloaded file, click "Extract All"


Enter the folder, and find the "Eclipse folder" and then double click on the Eclipse icon


Move the folder or icon to the desktop or a more accessible location in the C: drive




Github repo to Eclipse Workspace


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o-t2e0hxNHc




Download the Github repo at https://github.com/Anidude234/Java_Curriculum


On Windows, the file will need to be unzipped


In Eclipse, go to File 
 Import 
 General 
 Existing Projects in Workspace


Find the downloaded repo and click "Finish"
